intro: Alysicarpus ludens, commonly known as the Indian mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
